bibliographic-data.invention-title: ALLOCATING REBATE POINTS

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism for issuing advertising rebates to the advertisers in the form of advertiser points. In one aspect the points can be issued as a function of a points ratio that can be determined and/or updated periodically based upon customer ratings. In another aspect, the customer ratings can be employed in order to calculate a points credit/debit balance that can be awarded to the merchant at the end of a period.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Ad publisher performance and mitigation of click fraud

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising architecture in the advertising space, e.g., for ranking publishers of ads and/or mitigating click-fraud. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions that occur between a customer and a merchant as well as an indication of which ad publisher made the referral. Accordingly, the performance of an ad displayed by a publisher can be assessed, and, e.g., employed in the pricing scheme for displaying the ad. The ad publisher performance ratio can be relative to other ad publishers and can be employed with a pay-per-click, pay-per impression, or other similar billing structures.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Ad targeting and/or pricing based on customer behavior

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided for ad targeting and pricing based upon customer behavior. Accordingly, the ad(s) displayed to customers can be based upon the customer's transaction history. The transaction history can be determined based upon a distribution of points the customer receives upon completing a transaction with a merchant as well as search terms or keywords within a query or a document. The transaction history can be private and can be modified and/or purged by the customer to ensure the proper types of ads are displayed.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: OMAHA - user price incentive model

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents a system and method to compensate a user of a service platform in return for information regarding the user's intent. The compensation comprises rewards points and direct payments, which can be used to claim rewards online and offline. The compensation is securely maintained in compensation accounts. The user can benefit from third-party content and servicesthrough partnerships with the service platform. The intent-compensation proposition of the service platform creates a price incentive to use the service platform over its competitors.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: OMAHA-USER PRICE INCENTIVE MODEL
PREISANREIZMODELL FÜR OMAHA-BENUTZER
MODÈLE INCITANT PAR UN PRIX UN UTILISATEUR D'OMAHA

MODÈLE INCITANT PAR UN PRIX UN UTILISATEUR D'OMAHA
AD TARGETING AND/OR PRICING BASED ON CUSTOMER BEHAVIOR

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided for ad targeting and pricing based upon customer behavior. Accordingly, the ad(s) displayed to customers can be based upon the customer's transaction history. The transaction history can be determined based upon a distribution of points the customer receives upon completing a transaction with a merchant as well as search terms or keywords within a query or a document. The transaction history can be private and can be modified and/or purged by the customer to ensure the proper types of ads are displayed.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD PUBLISHER PERFORMANCE AND MITIGATION OF CLICK FRAUD

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising architecture in the advertising space, e.g., for ranking publishers of ads and/or mitigating click-fraud. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions that occur between a customer and a merchant as well as an indication of which ad publisher made the referral. Accordingly, the performance of an ad displayed by a publisher can be assessed, and, e.g., employed in the pricing scheme for displaying the ad. The ad publisher performance ratio can be relative to other ad publishers and can be employed with a pay-per-click, pay-per impression, or other similar billing structures.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Omaha-user price incentive model

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents a system and method to compensate a user of a service platform in return for information regarding the user's intent. The compensation comprises rewards points and direct payments, which can be used to claim rewards online and offline. The compensation is securely maintained in compensation accounts. The user can benefit from third-party content and services through partnerships with the service platform. The intent-compensation proposition of the service platform creates a price incentive to use the service platform over its competitors.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Advertiser backed compensation for end users

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents systems and methods to compensate directly a user of a service platform through advertising spending in exchange for knowledge of the user intent. Advertising spending contributions are allocated to a compensation account that can be accessed by an advertising platform, affiliated with the service platform or not, to compensate users and to update compensation records and transactions with the advertiser. Compensation fraud is actively and reactively mitigated. Compensation of the user is conducted securely and includes compensation points, direct payments and instant rebates, which can be used in transactions with online and offline service platforms. The intent-compensation proposition funded through advertising spending creates a price incentive that differentiates both service platform and advertiser from their competitors, and creates value for user and advertiser.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: MERCHANT RANKINGS IN AD REFERRALS

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising ranking architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions even without monitoring them e.g., and, once verified, the customer can rank the merchant based upon the customer's satisfaction with the merchant and/or the underlying transaction. The merchant ranking can be calculated in a variety of ways, and utilized to modify the pricing of an ad for that merchant, as well as which customers will be presented the ad, or even if the ad not be display (e.g., due to a low ranking). Merchants with high rankings can be attracted with incentives, improving the overall quality of the ads, which can attract more consumers.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD TARGETING AND/OR PRICING BASED ON CUSTOMER BEHAVIOR

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided for ad targeting and pricing based upon customer behavior. Accordingly, the ad(s) displayed to customers can be based upon the customer's transaction history. The transaction history can be determined based upon a distribution of points the customer receives upon completing a transaction with a merchant as well as search terms or keywords within a query or a document. The transaction history can be private and can be modified and/or purged by the customer to ensure the proper types of ads are displayed.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SEARCH ENGINE SEGMENTATION

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates market segmentation among search engines. A segmentation mechanism is provided that displays a plurality of search engines that can be employed in connection with a plurality of search types. Thus, an Internet search query can be analyzed, e.g., by keywords to determine a type of search being performed, and subsequently directed to the search engine selected for that type rather than all search queries going to a single search engine. The routing of a query can be based upon a user's choices, which takes advantage of the fact that some search engines perform better than others based upon the type of search. The segmentation mechanism can be built into, e.g., an operating system, a browser and the like, and can be easily configured.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: EMPLOYING CUSTOMER POINTS TO CONFIRM TRANSACTION

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions even without monitoring them e.g., by issuing perishable, non-redeemable points to a merchant based upon an advertising budget. The points can then be issued as redeemable points to a customer, e.g., based upon the customer makes a purchase from the merchant. Points transferred to the customer can verify that a transaction occurred, and can be redeemed for products/services, including a convenient "micro-payment" mechanism.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD PUBLISHER PERFORMANCE AND MITIGATION OF CLICK FRAUD

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising architecture in the advertising space, e.g., for ranking publishers of ads and/or mitigating click-fraud. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions that occur between a customer and a merchant as well as an indication of which ad publisher made the referral. Accordingly, the performance of an ad displayed by a publisher can be assessed, and, e.g., employed in the pricing scheme for displaying the ad. The ad publisher performance ratio can be relative to other ad publishers and can be employed with a pay-per-click, pay-per impression, or other similar billing structures.

The compensation comprises rewards points and direct payments, which can be used to claim rewards online and offline. The compensation is securely maintained in compensation accounts. The user can benefit from third-party content and services through partnerships with the service platform. The intent-compensation proposition of the service platform creates a price incentive to use the service platform over its competitors.

Compensation fraud is actively and reactively mitigated. Compensation of the user is conducted securely and includes compensation points, direct payments and instant rebates, which can be used in transactions with online and offline service platforms. bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD PUBLISHER PERFORMANCE AND MITIGATION OF CLICK FRAUD
PERFORMANCE D'ÉDITEUR PUBLICITAIRE ET RÉDUCTION DE FRAUDE AU CLIC

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising architecture in the advertising space, e.g., for ranking publishers of ads and/or mitigating click-fraud. A mechanism is provided to confirm transactions that occur between a customer and a merchant as well as an indication of which ad publisher made the referral. Accordingly, the performance of an ad displayed by a publisher can be assessed, and, e.g., employed in the pricing scheme for displaying the ad. The ad publisher performance ratio can be relative to other ad publishers and can be employed with a pay-per-click, pay-per impression, or other similar billing structures.

L'invention concerne un mécanisme permettant de faciliter la mise en oeuvre d'une nouvelle architecture publicitaire dans un espace publicitaire, destiné, par exemple, à classer des éditeurs de publicités et/ou à réduire la fraude au clic. L'invention concerne un mécanisme permettant de confirmer des transactions s'effectuant entre un client et un commerçant, et de confirmer une indication selon laquelle un éditeur de publicités a effectué une recommandation. Par conséquent, la performance d'une publicité effectuée par un éditeur peut être évaluée, et utilisée par exemple, dans le programme d'établissement de prix destiné à l'affichage de cette publicité.

Le rapport de performance d'éditeur de publicités peut s'effectuer par rapport à d'autres éditeurs de publicités et peut être utilisé avec une structure de facturation d'infographie facturable à la pièce, d'infographie facturable à l'impression, ou d'autres structures de facturation analogues.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD TARGETING AND/OR PRICING BASED ON CUSTOMER BEHAVIOR
MÉCANISME DE CIBLAGE PUBLICITAIRE ET/OU D'ÉTABLISSEMENT DE PRIX DE PUBLICITÉS FONDÉ SUR LE COMPORTEMENT D'UN CONSOMMATEUR

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided for ad targeting and pricing based upon customer behavior. Accordingly, the ad(s) displayed to customers can be based upon the customer's transaction history. The transaction history can be determined based upon a distribution of points the customer receives upon completing a transaction with a merchant as well as search terms or keywords within a query or a document. The transaction history can be private and can be modified and/or purged by the customer to ensure the proper types of ads are displayed.

L'invention concerne un mécanisme permettant une mise oeuvre facile d'une nouvelle architecture publicitaire et/ou de recommandations, dans un espace publicitaire Internet, destiné, par exemple, à faire de la publicité sur des pages Web de moteur de recherche et/ou sur des pages Web de contenu. L'invention concerne un mécanisme destiné à cibler des publicités et à établir des prix de publicités en fonction d'un comportement de consommateur. La publicité ou les publicités affichée(s) pour les consommateurs peut (peuvent) être fondée(s) sur l'historique des transactions de ce consommateur. L'historique des transactions peut être déterminé en fonction d'une distribution de points que le consommateur reçoit, lors de la conclusion d'une transaction avec un commerçant, et en fonction de termes de recherche ou de mots-clés contenus dans une demande ou dans un document.
Cet historique de transactions peut être privé et peut être modifié et/ou purgé par le consommateur pour garantir que des types de publicité appropriés sont affichés.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AD TARGETING AND/OR PRICING BASED ON CUSTOMER BEHAVIOR
MÉCANISME DE CIBLAGE PUBLICITAIRE ET/OU D'ÉTABLISSEMENT DE PRIX DE PUBLICITÉS FONDÉ SUR LE COMPORTEMENT D'UN CONSOMMATEUR

abstract.p: The claimed subject matter can provide a mechanism that facilitates a new advertising and/or referral architecture in the Internet advertising space, e.g., for advertising on search engine web pages and/or on content web pages. A mechanism is provided for ad targeting and pricing based upon customer behavior. Accordingly, the ad(s) displayed to customers can be based upon the customer's transaction history. The transaction history can be determined based upon a distribution of points the customer receives upon completing a transaction with a merchant as well as search terms or keywords within a query or a document. The transaction history can be private and can be modified and/or purged by the customer to ensure the proper types of ads are displayed.

L'invention concerne un mécanisme permettant une mise oeuvre facile d'une nouvelle architecture publicitaire et/ou de recommandations, dans un espace publicitaire Internet, destiné, par exemple, à faire de la publicité sur des pages Web de moteur de recherche et/ou sur des pages Web de contenu. L'invention concerne un mécanisme destiné à cibler des publicités et à établir des prix de publicités en fonction d'un comportement de consommateur. La publicité ou les publicités affichée(s) pour les consommateurs peut (peuvent) être fondée(s) sur l'historique des transactions de ce consommateur. L'historique des transactions peut être déterminé en fonction d'une distribution de points que le consommateur reçoit, lors de la conclusion d'une transaction avec un commerçant, et en fonction de termes de recherche ou de mots-clés contenus dans une demande ou dans un document.
Cet historique de transactions peut être privé et peut être modifié et/ou purgé par le consommateur pour garantir que des types de publicité appropriés sont affichés.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: ADVERTISER BACKED COMPENSATION FOR END USERS
COMPENSATION GARANTIE PAR L'ANNONCEUR POUR UTILISATEURS FINALS

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents systems and methods to compensate directly a user of a service platform through advertising spending in exchange for knowledge of the user intent. Advertising spending contributions are allocated to a compensation account that can be accessed by an advertising platform, affiliated with the service platform or not, to compensate users and to update compensation records and transactions with the advertiser. Compensation fraud is actively and reactively mitigated. Compensation of the user is conducted securely and includes compensation points, direct payments and instant rebates, which can be used in transactions with online and offline service platforms. The intent-compensation proposition funded through advertising spending creates a price incentive that differentiates both service platform and advertiser from their competitors, and creates value for user and advertiser.

L'invention concerne des systèmes et des procédés permettant de compenser directement un utilisateur d'une plate-forme de services par des dépenses de publicité en échange de la connaissances de l'intention de l'utilisateur. Les contributions de dépenses de publicité sont allouées à un compte de compensation qui peut être accédé par une plate-forme de publicité, affiliée ou non à la plate-forme de services, afin de compenser des utilisateurs et d'actualiser des enregistrements de compensation et des transactions avec l'annonceur. Une fraude de compensation est limitée de manière active et réactive. Une compensation de l'utilisateur est effectuée de manière sécurisée et comprend des points de compensation, des paiements directs et des rabais immédiats, qui peuvent être utilisés dans des transactions avec des plates-formes de service en ligne ou non.

La proposition de compensation contre intention financée par des dépenses de publicité crée un prix incitatif qui différencie la plate-forme de services et l'annonceur de leurs concurrents, et créé une valeur pour l'utilisateur et l'annonceur

bibliographic-data.invention-title: OMAHA-USER PRICE INCENTIVE MODEL
MODÈLE INCITANT PAR UN PRIX UN UTILISATEUR D'OMAHA

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents a system and method to compensate a user of a service platform in return for information regarding the user's intent. The compensation comprises rewards points and direct payments, which can be used to claim rewards online and offline. The compensation is securely maintained in compensation accounts. The user can benefit from third-party content and services through partnerships with the service platform. The intent-compensation proposition of the service platform creates a price incentive to use the service platform over its competitors.

L'invention concerne un système et un procédé permettant de compenser l'utilisateur d'une plateforme de services contre des informations concernant l'intention de cet utilisateur. Cette compensation comprend des points de récompenses et des paiements directs, qui peuvent être utilisés pour réclamer des récompenses en ligne ou non. Cette compensation est maintenue de manière sécurisée dans des comptes de compensation. L'utilisateur peut bénéficier de contenu et de services de parties tierces par des partenariats avec la plate-forme de services. La proposition de compensation contre intention de la plate-forme de services crée un prix incitant à utiliser la plate-forme de services plutôt que celles de ses concurrents.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: OMAHA-USER PRICE INCENTIVE MODEL
MODÈLE INCITANT PAR UN PRIX UN UTILISATEUR D'OMAHA

abstract.p: The claimed subject invention presents a system and method to compensate a user of a service platform in return for information regarding the user's intent. The compensation comprises rewards points and direct payments, which can be used to claim rewards online and offline. The compensation is securely maintained in compensation accounts. The user can benefit from third-party content and services through partnerships with the service platform. The intent-compensation proposition of the service platform creates a price incentive to use the service platform over its competitors.

L'invention concerne un système et un procédé permettant de compenser l'utilisateur d'une plateforme de services contre des informations concernant l'intention de cet utilisateur. Cette compensation comprend des points de récompenses et des paiements directs, qui peuvent être utilisés pour réclamer des récompenses en ligne ou non. Cette compensation est maintenue de manière sécurisée dans des comptes de compensation. L'utilisateur peut bénéficier de contenu et de services de parties tierces par des partenariats avec la plate-forme de services. La proposition de compensation contre intention de la plate-forme de services crée un prix incitant à utiliser la plate-forme de services plutôt que celles de ses concurrents.
